Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION (ETA), THROUGH A GRANT TO THE MINNESOTA EMPLOYMENT SECURITY COMMISSION, FUNDS THE ANALYST RESOURCE CENTER (ARC). THE ARC IS A CONSORTIUM OF DATABASE ADMINSTRATORS, ECONOMISTS, STATISTICIANS AND STATE LABOR MARKET INFORMATION (LMI) DIRECTORS FROM SEVERAL STATES RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING A VARIETY OF INFORMATION PRODUCTS TO THE STATE LMI AGENCIES, STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (SWAS), WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS, AND OTHER CUSTOMERS. THESE PRODUCTS ARE DESIGNED TO ENHANCE LABOR MARKET AND WORKFORCE INFORMATION SERVICE DELIVERY TO CUSTOMERS IN THE EMPLOYMENT, EDUCATION, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT SECTORS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
SPECIFICALLY, THE ARC MANAGES THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS.
•	EMPLOYER DATABASE, A PROPRIETARY DATABASE THAT INCLUDES NAMES, ADDRESSES, TELEPHONE NUMBERS, AND INDUSTRY DESIGNATIONS FOR OVER 13 MILLION BUSINESSES THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY. THIS DATABASE IS A KEY INPUT TO THE NATIONAL ELECTRONIC TOOLS AND STATE LMI AND WORKFORCE INFORMATION WEB SITES.
•	NATIONAL CROSSWALK SERVICE CENTER (NCSC) SERVES AS THE NATIONAL CLEARINGHOUSE AND ONE-STOP RESOURCE FOR OCCUPATIONAL AND OTHER CLASSIFICATION SYSTEMS FOR USE IN THE NATIONAL ELECTRONIC TOOLS, STATE LMI AND WORKFORCE INFORMATION WEB SITES, OCCUPATIONAL RESEARCHERS, JOB SEEKERS, INTERMEDIARY ORGANIZATIONS AND A WIDE VARIETY OF PUBLIC, NON-PROFIT, AND PRIVATE SECTOR BUSINESSES AND ORGANIZATIONS.
•	LOCAL EMPLOYMENTAND WAGE INFORMATION SYSTEM (LEWIS), FORMALEY EDS, IS AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM FOR PRODUCING EMPLOYMENT AND WAGE ESTIMATES (DERIVED FROM THE OCCUPATIONAL EMPLOYMENT STATISTICS (OES) SURVEYS) FOR GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS THAT THE BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS (BLS) DOES NOT INCLUDE (COUNTIES, CITIES, TOWNS AND WORKFORCE INVESTMENT BOARD (WIB) AREAS). LEWIS IS THE ONLY TOOL THAT PRODUCES SUCH GEOGRAPHICALLY-DETAILED OCCUPATIONAL STAFFING PATTERNS (A LIST OF THE OCCUPATIONS EMPLOYED WITHIN A PARTICULAR FOUR-DIGIT NAICS CODE INDUSTRY) AND SUB-STATE OCCUPATIONAL EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS. STATE EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS AND LOCAL PROJECTIONS CANNOT BE PRODUCED WITHOUT SUB-STATE OCCUPATIONAL STAFFING PATTERNS.


DELIVERABLES
THE ARC IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECT TEAM RESPONSIBILITIES TO PRODUCE VARIOUS GRANT DELIVERABLES. WIDB PROJECT
1)	IDENTIFIES CORE WORKFORCE INFORMATION DATABASE ELEMENTS THAT MUST BE POPULATED BY STATES TO SATISFY CORE PRODUCT REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE FORMULA FUNDED WORKFORCE INFORMATION GRANTS TO STATES.
2)	COORDINATES AND COLLABORATES ON PROJECTS RELATED TO THE ENHANCEMENT, APPLICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF LABOR MARKET INFORMATION.
3)	SERVES AS THE CENTRAL POINT OF CONTACT FOR THE INSTALLATION, POPULATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE WORKFORCE INFORMATION DATABASE AND THE COMMON FILES (E.G., CROSSWALKS, LOOKUP TABLES, ETC.).
4)	PROVIDES INFORMATION, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO STATE STAFF WHO POPULATE AND MAINTAIN THE WIDB.

NCSC PROJECT:
1)	UPDATES AND POPULATES THE NATIONAL OCCUPATIONAL CROSSWALK TABLES.
2)	PROVIDES A NATIONAL ONE-STOP RESOURCE FOR CLASSIFICATION AND CROSSWALK RESOURCES.
3)	EXPLOITS INTERNET TECHNOLOGY AND COMMUNICATION APPROACHES TO SHARE FILES, IDEAS, FEEDBACK, ETC. AMONG PRODUCERS AND USERS OF OCCUPATIONAL, TRAINING AND ECONOMIC INFORMATION.

LEWIS PROJECT:
1)	OPERATES AND MAINTIANS THE LEWIS SOFTWARE AND PLATFORM.
2)	PROVIDES INFORMATION, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR THE LEWIS SYSTEM.
3)	SERVES AS THE CENTRAL POINT OF CONTACT AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT FOR ALL MATTERS PERTAINING TO THE LEWIS SYSTEM.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
ETA HAS FUNDED THE ARC TO CARRY OUT THE ACTIVITIES EMBODIED IN THIS GRANT FOR OVER 17 YEARS. THIS LONGSTANDING PARTNERSHIP IS JOINTLY MANAGED BY THE GRANTEE AND FULL-TIME ETA PROGRAM STAFF OF THE OFFICE OF WORKFORCE INVESTMENT IN THE DIVISION OF NATIONAL PROGRAMS, TOOLS, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. ETA BELIEVES THAT THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS FROM FOSTERING STATE COLLABORATION BETWEEN STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (SWAS), AND STATE LABOR MARKET INFORMATION ENTITIES' MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
THE COMMON REPORTING INFORMATION SYSTEM (CRIS) IS A FORMAL PARTNERSHIP WITH THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE (KDOC) TO MANAGE REQUESTS FOR AGGREGATE WAGE RECORD DATA, AVAILABLE THROUGH THE STATE WAGE RECORD INTERCHANGE SYSTEM (SWIS) ON BEHALF OF THE EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION'S (ETA) NATIONAL AND DISCRETIONARY GRANT PROGRAMS. CRIS CONNECTS GRANTEES THAT WOULD BE OTHERWISE UNABLE TO ACCESS STATE WAGE RECORDS AND FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT INFORMATION WITH A SOURCE OF SUCH JOB PLACEMENT DATA IN ORDER MEET PERFORMANCE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THIS INTERCONNECTIVITY ENHANCES THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE RATE OF SUCCESS OF THE STATE, LOCAL AND DIRECT GRANT PARTNER PROGRAMS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE ACTIVITY TO BE FUNDED IS ESSENTIAL TO THE SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF AN ACTIVITY PRESENTLY FUNDED BY DOL, WHEREIN COMPETITION WOULD RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT OR REAL: 	EXPENSES IN EXCESS OF ANY POTENTIAL SAVINGS TO THE GOVERNMENT; SEVERE DISRUPTION TO PROGRAM SERVICES AND REQUIRED WIOA PERFORMANCE REPORTING; AND DUPLICATION OF WORK AT ADDITIONAL COST TO THE GOVERNMENT.

DELIVERABLES
IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THE STATED PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AND FACILITATE ACCESS TO FEDERAL WAGE RECORDS IN THE MOST COST EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT MANNER, THE TASKS TO BE PERFORMED BY KDOC INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO): QUERYING THE SWIS AND FED ES (WHEN OPERATIONAL) ON BEHALF OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP, NATIONAL FARMWORKER JOBS PROGRAM, SENIOR COMMUNITY SERVICE EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, INDIAN AND NATIVE AMERICAN PROGRAM, YOUTHBUILD, REENTRY EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, JOB CORPS, AND H-LB GRANTS; PROVIDING ETA WITH QUARTERLY AGGREGATE RESULTS FOR THE COMMON PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOR THE PROGRAMS LISTED ABOVE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
CRIS CONNECTS GRANTEES THAT WOULD BE OTHERWISE UNABLE TO ACCESS STATE WAGE RECORDS AND FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT INFORMATION WITH A SOURCE OF SUCH JOB PLACEMENT DATA IN ORDER MEET PERFORMANCE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THIS INTERCONNECTIVITY ENHANCES THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE RATE OF SUCCESS OF THE STATE, LOCAL AND DIRECT GRANT PARTNER PROGRAMS.  KDOC SERVES AS A CONDUIT FOR ETA'S NATIONAL AND DISCRETIONARY GRANTEES TO ACCESS WAGE RECORDS OF PARTICIPANTS IN VARIOUS PROGRAMS. SPECIFICALLY, ETA PROVIDES KDOC WITH SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBERS AND OTHER NECESSARY INFORMATION ON PARTICIPANTS WHO RECEIVED EMPLOYMENT AND JOB TRAINING PROGRAM SERVICES COVERED BY THE CRIS AGREEMENT. KDOC QUERIES THE SWIS AND THE FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT DATA EXCHANGE SYSTEM  (FEDES) (WHEN FEDES IS OPERATIONAL) FOR WAGE RECORDS. KDOC THEN PROVIDES THE AGGREGATE DATA TO ETA, WHICH IS SHARED WITH ET A'S NATIONAL AND DISCRETIONARY GRANTEES. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE ESSENTIAL STATE AND LOCAL LABOR MARKET INFORMATION (LMI) FOR A RANGE OF CUSTOMER GROUPS: 1) JOB SEEKERS; 2) BUSINESSES/EMPLOYERS; 3) WORKFORCE AND LABOR MARKET INTERMEDIARIES SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT, SCHOOL, AND CAREER COUNSELORS, AND CASE MANAGERS AT AMERICAN JOB CENTERS, WHO HELP INDIVIDUALS FIND A JOB OR MAKE CAREER DECISIONS, OR ENGAGE BUSINESSES SEEKING SKILLED WORKERS; 4) PROGRAM AND SERVICE PLANNERS AT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS; 5) POLICY MAKERS, INCLUDING STATE AND LOCAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BOARDS (WDBS); 6) PARTNERS, SUCH AS ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ENTITIES AND HUMAN RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS; AND 7) OTHER CUSTOMERS, INCLUDING RECIPIENTS OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS, RESEARCHERS, COMMERCIAL DATA PROVIDERS, AND THE MEDIA.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
GRANTEES MUST POPULATE AND MAINTAIN A DATABASE (THE WORKFORCE INFORMATION DATABASE OR WID), PRODUCE TWO TYPES OF PUBLIC PRODUCTS (EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS AND A STATEWIDE ECONOMIC ANALYSIS REPORT), AND ENSURE LMI STAFF ARE ADEQUATELY TRAINED. ETA ALSO ENCOURAGES GRANTEES TO PRODUCE OTHER REPORTS AND DATA IN ADDITION TO THOSE REQUIRED. GRANTEES HAVE WIDE DISCRETION IN BOTH THE TOPICS AND PRESENTATION FORMAT. THESE REPORTS SHOULD INCLUDE ACCURATE DATA, ACTIONABLE INFORMATION, AND RESOURCES THAT ENABLE DATA USERS TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT THE REEMPLOYMENT, WORK-BASED LEARNING, TRAINING, AND CAREER PATHWAYS STRATEGIES THAT LEAD TO RAPID REEMPLOYMENT AND WORKER ADVANCEMENT ALONG A CONTINUUM OF HIGH-DEMAND AND HIGHER WAGE JOBS.

DELIVERABLES
BY PERFORMING THESE DUTIES USERS OF LMI WILL HAVE SUFFICIENT INFORMATION TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS REGARDING EMPLOYMENT, CAREERS, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
JOB SEEKERS, EMPLOYERS, STAFF IN AMERICAN JOB CENTERS, STATE AND LOCAL WDBS, NATIONAL/STATE/LOCAL POLICY MAKERS, STUDENTS, ACADEMIC RESEARCHERS, LABOR MARKET ANALYSTS, AND OTHER USERS OF LMI.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
A STATE MAY USE WIGS FUNDING TO WORK WITH A SUBRECIPIENT TO CONDUCT A STUDY OR RESEARCH AN LMI TOPIC WHEN A STATE LMI OFFICE DOES NOT HAVE SUFFICIENT STAFFING OR KNOWLEDGE TO CONDUCT THE WORK THEMSELVES.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THE EMPLOYMENT SERVICE (ES) PROGRAM IS TO BRING TOGETHER INDIVIDUALS LOOKING FOR EMPLOYMENT AND EMPLOYERS LOOKING FOR JOB SEEKERS. THE PROGRAM DOES THIS BY PROVIDING A VARIETY OF SERVICES, WHICH ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES JOB SEEKERS WITH CAREER SERVICES, INCLUDING LABOR EXCHANGE SERVICES, JOB SEARCH ASSISTANCE, WORKFORCE INFORMATION, REFERRALS TO EMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. EMPLOYERS CAN USE THE ES TO POST JOB ORDERS AND OBTAIN QUALIFIED APPLICANTS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE ES IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED SERVICES. ALLOWABLE SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE WHEN APPROPRIATE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, AND REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE. SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS; MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS' EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES; HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS; ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS; ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING; AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM.

DELIVERABLES
THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE GRANTEES MAY SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT LMI RESEARCH AS WELL AS THE PROVISION OF SPECIFIC SERVICES SUCH AS ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE, AND OTHERS.

THE PROGRAM PROVIDES JOB SEEKERS WITH CAREER SERVICES, INCLUDING LABOR EXCHANGE SERVICES, JOB SEARCH ASSISTANCE, WORKFORCE INFORMATION, REFERRALS TO EMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. EMPLOYERS CAN USE THE ES TO POST JOB ORDERS AND OBTAIN QUALIFIED APPLICANTS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE ES IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED SERVICES. ALLOWABLE SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE WHEN APPROPRIATE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, AND REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE. SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS; MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS' EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES; HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS; ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS; ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING; AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM.

DELIVERABLES
THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS.

ALLOWABLE SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE WHEN APPROPRIATE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, AND REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE. SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS; MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS' EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES; HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS; ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS; ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING; AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM.

THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.

SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS; MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS' EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES; HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS; ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS; ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING; AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM.

DELIVERABLES
THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS.

SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS  MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS  EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES  HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS  ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS  ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING  AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANTEES MAY SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT LMI RESEARCH AS WELL AS THE PROVISION OF SPECIFIC SERVICES SUCH AS ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE, AND OTHERS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE ES PROGRAM IS TO BRING TOGETHER INDIVIDUALS LOOKING FOR EMPLOYMENT AND EMPLOYERS LOOKING FOR JOB SEEKERS. THE PROGRAM DOES THIS BY PROVIDING A VARIETY OF SERVICES, WHICH ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES JOB SEEKERS WITH CAREER SERVICES, INCLUDING LABOR EXCHANGE SERVICES, JOB SEARCH ASSISTANCE, WORKFORCE INFORMATION, REFERRALS TO EMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. EMPLOYERS CAN USE THE ES TO POST JOB ORDERS AND OBTAIN QUALIFIED APPLICANTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ES IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED SERVICES. ALLOWABLE SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE WHEN APPROPRIATE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, AND REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE. SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS  MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS  EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES  HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS  ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD-TO-FILL JOB ORDERS  ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING  AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID-OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANTEES MAY SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT LMI RESEARCH AS WELL AS THE PROVISION OF SPECIFIC SERVICES SUCH AS ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE, AND OTHERS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE ESSENTIAL STATE AND LOCALLABOR MARKET INFORMATION (LMI) FOR A RANGE OF CUSTOMER GROUPS: 1) JOB SEEKERS  2) BUSINESSES EMPLOYERS  3) WORKFORCE AND LABOR MARKET INTERMEDIARIES SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT, SCHOOL, AND CAREER COUNSELORS, AND CASE MANAGERS AT AMERICAN JOB CENTERS, WHO HELP INDIVIDUALS FIND A JOB OR MAKE CAREER DECISIONS, OR ENGAGE BUSINESSES SEEKING SKILLED WORKERS  4) PROGRAM AND SERVICE PLANNERS AT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS  5) POLICY MAKERS, INCLUDING STATE AND LOCAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BOARDS (WDBS)  6) PARTNERS, SUCH AS ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ENTITIES AND HUMAN RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS  AND 7) OTHER CUSTOMERS, INCLUDING RECIPIENTS OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS, RESEARCHERS, COMMERCIAL DATA PROVIDERS, AND THE MEDIA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GRANTEES MUST POPULATE AND MAINTAIN A DATABASE (THE WORKFORCE INFORMATION DATABASE OR WID), PRODUCE TWO TYPES OF PUBLIC PRODUCTS (EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS AND A STATEWIDE ECONOMIC ANALYSIS REPORT), AND ENSURE LMI STAFF ARE ADEQUATELY TRAINED.  ETA ALSO ENCOURAGES GRANTEES TO PRODUCE OTHER REPORTS AND DATA IN ADDITION TO THOSE REQUIRED. GRANTEES HAVE WIDE DISCRETION IN BOTH THE TOPICS AND PRESENTATION FORMAT. THESE REPORTS SHOULD INCLUDE ACCURATE DATA, ACTIONABLE INFORMATION, AND RESOURCES THAT ENABLE DATA USERS TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT THE REEMPLOYMENT, WORK-BASED LEARNING, TRAINING, AND CAREER PATHWAYS STRATEGIES THAT LEAD TO RAPID REEMPLOYMENT AND WORKER ADVANCEMENT ALONG A CONTINUUM OF HIGH-DEMAND AND HIGHER WAGE JOBS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY PERFORMING THESE DUTIES USERS OF LMI WILL HAVE SUFFICIENT INFORMATION TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS REGARDING EMPLOYMENT, CAREERS, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: JOB SEEKERS, EMPLOYERS, STAFF IN AMERICAN JOB CENTERS, STATE AND LOCAL WDBS, NATIONAL STATE LOCAL POLICY MAKERS, STUDENTS, ACADEMIC RESEARCHERS, LABOR MARKET ANALYSTS, AND OTHER USERS OF LMI.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: A STATE MAY USE WIGS FUNDING TO WORK WITH A SUBRECIPIENT TO CONDUCT A STUDY OR RESEARCH AN LMI TOPIC WHEN A STATE LMI OFFICE DOES NOT HAVE SUFFICIENTSTAFFING OR KNOWLEDGE TO CONDUCT THE WORK THEMSELVES.

PURPOSE  THE PURPOSE OF THE EMPLOYMENT SERVICE (ES) PROGRAM IS TO BRING TOGETHER INDIVIDUALS LOOKING FOR EMPLOYMENT AND EMPLOYERS LOOKING FOR JOB SEEKERS. THE PROGRAM DOES THIS BY PROVIDING A VARIETY OF SERVICES, WHICH ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES JOB SEEKERS WITH CAREER SERVICES, INCLUDING LABOR EXCHANGE SERVICES, JOB SEARCH ASSISTANCE, WORKFORCE INFORMATION, REFERRALS TO EMPLOYMENT, AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. EMPLOYERS CAN USE THE ES TO POST JOB ORDERS AND OBTAIN QUALIFIED APPLICANTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE ES IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED SERVICES. ALLOWABLE SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE WHEN APPROPRIATE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, AND REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE. SERVICES OFFERED TO EMPLOYERS INCLUDE REFERRAL OF JOB SEEKERS TO JOB OPENINGS  MATCHING JOB REQUIREMENTS WITH APPLICANTS  EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND OTHER ATTRIBUTES  HELPING WITH SPECIAL RECRUITMENT NEEDS  ASSISTING EMPLOYERS WITH HARD TO FILL JOB ORDERS  ASSISTING WITH JOB RESTRUCTURING  AND HELPING EMPLOYERS ASSIST LAID OFF WORKERS. TRAINING SERVICES ARE NOT PROVIDED AND NOT ALLOWABLE UNDER ES PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THE ES PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO ACCESS AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND REENTER THE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THIS IS A UNIVERSAL ACCESS PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE TO ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE US CITIZENS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THE GRANTEES MAY SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT LMI RESEARCH AS WELL AS THE PROVISION OF SPECIFIC SERVICES SUCH AS ASSESSMENTS OF CAREER INTERESTS, CAREER GUIDANCE, JOB SEARCH WORKSHOPS, REFERRAL TO JOBS OR TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE, AND OTHERS.
